intro: Osbeckia nepalensis var. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered osbeckia, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan regions of Nepal and adjacent areas. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and alternate leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the summer months. Its flowers are typically tubular with five lobes, and it is adapted to grow in rocky or alpine environments. Osbeckia nepalensis var. albiflora is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in high-altitude ecosystems.
